thread.title: Mohammed Siraj Visits His Hometown On His B’day; Recalls The Time He Used To Flip Rumali Rotis And Burn His Hands
thread.title_full: Mohammed Siraj Visits His Hometown On His B’day; Recalls The Time He Used To Flip Rumali Rotis And Burn His Hands

author: Tooba Shaikh
title: Mohammed Siraj Visits His Hometown On His B’day; Recalls The Time He Used To Flip Rumali Rotis And Burn His Hands
text:
The famous cricket player, Mohammed Siraj, recently celebrated his 30th birthday. A favourite among many, this talented bowler recently visited his hometown in Hyderabad, Telangana. The Board of Control for Cricket in India or the BCCI recently filmed a short video of him in his hometown. He regaled the viewers with anecdotes and memories of his childhood days and even got a bit emotional about all that he had to experience during his struggle days.
Mohammed Siraj Visits His Locality In Hyderabad
🏠 𝙃𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙛𝙩. 𝙈𝙤𝙝𝙖𝙢𝙢𝙚𝙙 𝙎𝙞𝙧𝙖𝙟
As he celebrates his birthday, we head back to Hyderabad where it all began 👏
The pacer’s heartwarming success story is filled with struggles, nostalgia and good people 🤗
You’ve watched him bowl, now…
[pic.twitter.com/RfElTPrwmJ]
— BCCI (@BCCI)
[March 13, 2024]
Mohammed Siraj celebrated his birthday this year in his hometown. And the best part? He took his fans along with him. Siraj showed BCCI TV around his hood in Hyderabad. He even showed his neighbourhood in Hyderabad called Eidgah.
He showed people the ground where he grew up playing cricket and also his favourite chai spot in the city. At one point in the video, he gets a little sentimental while sharing that he used to work as a catered and helped his father, an autorickshaw driver who was the sole earning member of the family.
He said that he used to flip rumali rotis at the job till his hands burned. However, Siraj said he was grateful for the struggles and doesn’t regret it. He says that without those days of struggle, he perhaps wouldn’t have valued his success as much as he does now.

Mohammed Siraj Invited RCB Team To His Home To Relish Hyderabadi Biryani
Here’s What His Fans Had To Say About This Touching Video
This literally made me emotional
— Pallab🇮🇳 (@Pallab200205)
[March 13, 2024]
The video won the hearts of many of his already-adoring fans. They took to the comment section to commend the struggle that he has had to go through to get to where he is today. Many people even wished him a happy birthday!
From being called as RUN MACHINE in IPL.
To… Wicket taking machine for team 🇮🇳
— Varun Giri (@Varungiri0)
[March 13, 2024]
Fans couldn’t stop gushing about how proud they were of their favourite bowler. Truly, his journey is quite inspiring.
Happy Birthday Miyan bhai
— Satya Prakash (@Satya_Prakash08)
[March 13, 2024]
